url.imageAlt: A picture of a park with three trees marked with a red box signifying the locations of each memorial
A leafy tree where David Buck Memorial stands
An old and withered burial marker for David Richard Buck

description: On October 16th, 1989, a tree was planted in Alexander Park to “signify hope for the future” when it came to the AIDS crisis. The city was involved, and the current mayor John Millson was present. The tree does not exist anymore. There is a memorial tree in the park for David Buck however, who was a volunteer for the AIDS Committee of Windsor before his death in 1996. WERA is currently working with Pozitive Pathways to create a permanent monument in the park.
